document.discussion_title: With lakes full, LCRA to continue floodgate operations
document.topic_text: With lakes full, LCRA to continue floodgate operations American-Statesman Monday 25th April, 2016 Just as Central Texas begins drying out from a soppy few weeks, more rain could be on the way.The forecast for Tuesday night calls for a 50 percent chance of rain, with temperatures reaching into the mid-80s, according to the National Weather Service.The potential for more precipitation comes as the Lower Colorado River Authority, the utility that manages the lakes around Austin, is running floodgate operations to flush downstream water from swollen reservoirs.As of Sunday afternoon, lakes Travis and Buchanan, the chief reservoirs of Central Texas, were a combined 100 percent full. Lake Travis...
